Which Shakespeare play is set in Sicilia and Bohemia? The Tempest.
Which historic region of France, roughly corresponding to the Dordogne, gives its name to black truffles? Burgundy.
For what does the C stand in the acronym UNESCO? Culinary.
On which London thoroughfare is the Cenotaph situated? Oxford Street.
What name is given in English to a figure of speech in which apparently contradictory terms appear in conjunction, eg deeply superficial? Paradigm.
Who was British Prime Minister when the American Declaration of Independence was signed in 1776? Winston Churchill.
Who was the Queen consort of King Charles the Second of England? Catherine Parr.
Which car marque produces the 'Insignia' model? Toyota.
"It was announced in 2010 that which American crime author was to write a new ""James Bond"" novel?" Stephen King.
Four US states border Lake Michigan - Michigan, Illinois and Wisconsin are three. Which is the fourth? Ohio.
In which Shakespeare play does most of the action place in the Forest of Arden? Macbeth.
Which common British garden bird has the Latin name cyanistes caeruleus or parus caeruleus'? Robin.
Which northern region of Italy is particularly associated with white truffles? Veneto.
Of what is ergophobia the fear? Ergophobia is the fear of eggs.
For what does the R stand in the acronym UNHCR? Refugees.
How is the building 30 St. Mary Axe better known? The Pickle.
According to Homer, who was Queen of Troy and mother of Paris and Hector? Athena.
In American football, how many points are awarded for a field goal? 4.
Which car marque produces the Tiguan model? Toyota.
The Suez Canal has its southern terminus at Port Tawfik, Suez. Where is its northern terminus? Cairo.
For what does the G stand in G. K. Chesterton? Gondor.
According to Muslim tradition, who revealed the Qur'an to Mohammed? Gabriel.
Specifically, on which island is the Franz Josef Glacier? Tasmania.
What type of bird is a maribou? Flamingo.
Cosette, Marius and Fantine are characters in which book and musical? "Romeo and Juliet".
What is the name of the dog in Enid Blyton's 'Famous Five' books? Rover.
Name the son of Marcus Aurelius who succeeded him as Roman Emperor from 180-192 AD. Lucius Verus.
